definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: It's a single room with a bath, facing the south.
sentences.chinese: 一個朝南的帶浴盆的單人間。

sentences.english: I'd like a single room with two beds for two nights.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一個帶兩張牀的單人間住兩夜。

sentences.english: I'd like to have a single room, preferably facing south.
sentences.chinese: 我想訂一個單人間，最好是朝南。

sentences.english: What kind of room would you like (or prefer)? A single room or a double room ?
sentences.chinese: 您想定哪種房型呢，要單人間還是雙人房間？

sentences.english: Well, we've reserved four suites and eight single rooms for you at the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 噯，我們在賓館爲你們定了四個套間八個單人間。

sentences.english: Can you arrange a single room for me ?
sentences.chinese: 能給我按排一個單人間嗎？

sentences.english: I'm sorry, we have not any single-room on that day.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，那天的單人間已預訂完了。

sentences.english: Single. And I would prefer a room with a front view.
sentences.chinese: 單人間，我想要一個陽面的房間。

definition: standard (hotel) room/two-person room of standard size and amenities/abbr. to 标间
one bedroom and one living room
Hengchun town in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
abbr. for 標準間|标准间[biao1 zhun3 jian1], standard (hotel) room
Huangdao district of Qingdao city 青島市|青岛市, Shandong
to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
